column7: Typo – Please note that we cannot have "partial" proper transliteration (i.e. 'ā') and "partial" secular phoneticism (i.e. 'sh') occurring in a single word. Please consider this to be a Global correction across all dictionaries – that will save us from repeatedly making such a correction.
Typo – This term is generally written as a SINGLE word. Please note that this is a suggested Global Print Change across all dictionaries.
Typo – Please consider this to be a Global Correction across all dictionaries. It is worth noting that the "hyphen" is generally used in this case.
Typo – Please consider this to be a Global Correction across all dictionaries. It is worth noting that this meaning is generally written as a single word.
Typo – Please note that the general usage is without the hyphen. Therefore, please consider this to be a Global Correction across all dictionaries.

Typo – Please note that we cannot have "partial" proper transliteration (i.e. 'ā') and "partial" secular phoneticism (i.e. 'n' and 'ch') occurring in a single word. Please consider this to be a Global correction across all dictionaries – that will save us from repeatedly making such a correction. The important point here is that the letters: "n" and "ch" are misleading, because the correct letters are: "ñ" and "c".
Typo – Please note that the general usage is without the hyphen. Therefore, please consider this to be a Global Correction across all dictionaries.
Typo – You may consider to make this a Global Correction, as there is no other possible correct combination of these letters.
